org.sd.text.segment
Class SegmentMachine

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.segment.SegmentMachine

public class SegmentMachine
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to traverse segment sequences.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getSegmentSequence

setToEnd

public SegmentMachine setToEnd(boolean reset)
Set the current segment to the end of the sequence, clearing the current text if indicated.

setToBeginning

public SegmentMachine setToBeginning(boolean reset)

mark

public SegmentMachine mark(boolean reset)

setToMark

public SegmentMachine setToMark(boolean reset)

setStart

public SegmentMachine setStart(boolean reset)
Set the current segment to be the first segment of the sequence, clearing the current text if indicated.

Note that if the curSegment is null (at the end of the sequence), the sequence will be cleared!

setLast

public SegmentMachine setLast(boolean reset)
Set the current segment to be the last segment of the sequence, clearing the current text if indicated.

Note that if the curSegment is null (at the end of the sequence), the sequence will not be changed!

setEnd

public SegmentMachine setEnd(boolean reset)
Clip the current and following segments from the segment sequence, leaving the machine at the (new) end. Optionally reset curText.

resetLast

public SegmentMachine resetLast(java.lang.String lastString)
Set the current segment to be the last, resetting its text to be the given text. If the text to set is empty, then remove the current segment (and all following). If the current segment is beyond the last segment, add a segment with the non-empty text (or do nothing if text is empty).

As a side effect curText will be cleared and the machine will be positioned after the last segment.

public Segment getCurSegment()

getCurText

public java.lang.String getCurText(boolean reset)
Get the current text (without fixing). If reset, then empty the text buffer.

getCurText

public java.lang.String getCurText(boolean fix,
                                   boolean reset)
Get the current text. If fix, then remove extra whitespace and delims from ends. If reset, then empty the text buffer.

public static final java.lang.String fix(java.lang.String text)
Fix the text by removing extra whitespace and delims from the ends.

                               java.lang.Boolean value)
Check the prior non-white segment for the given feature.

nextHasFeature

public boolean nextHasFeature(java.lang.String feature,
                              java.lang.Boolean value)
Check the next non-white segment for the given feature.

forward

public boolean forward(int numSegments)
Go forward from the current segment the given number of segments or until hitting the end of the sequence. Ignore delims and whitespace for counting purposes.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

forward

public boolean forward(int numSegments,
                       boolean ignoreDelimsAndWhitespace)
Go forward from the current segment the given number of segments or until hitting the end of the sequence.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

forwardUntil

public boolean forwardUntil(java.lang.String feature,
                            java.lang.Boolean value)
Go forward from the current segment until hitting a segment with the given value for the feature.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

forwardThrough

public boolean forwardThrough(java.lang.String feature,
                              java.lang.Boolean value)
Go forward from the current segment until hitting a segment with the given value for the feature. Continue moving forward through segments until reaching a segment for which the feature does NOT have the value. Ignore delims and whitespace.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

forwardThrough

public boolean forwardThrough(java.lang.String feature,
                              java.lang.Boolean value,
                              boolean ignoreDelimsAndWhitespace)
Go forward from the current segment until hitting a segment with the given value for the feature. Continue moving forward through segments until reaching a segment for which the feature does NOT have the value.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

forwardToEnd

public boolean forwardToEnd()
Go forward from the current segment until hitting the end.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

backward

public boolean backward(int numSegments)
Go backward from the current segment the given number of segments or until hitting the first segment. Ignore delims and whitespace for counting purposes.

Insert text from the current segment's predecessor up to and including the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

backward

public boolean backward(int numSegments,
                        boolean ignoreDelimsAndWhitespace)
Go backward from the current segment the given number of segments or until hitting the first segment.

Insert text from the current segment's predecessor up to and including the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

backwardUntil

public boolean backwardUntil(java.lang.String feature,
                             java.lang.Boolean value)
Go backward from the current segment until the prior segment has the given value for the feature.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Insert text from the current segment's predecessor up to and including the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

backwardThrough

public boolean backwardThrough(java.lang.String feature,
                               java.lang.Boolean value)
Go backward from the current segment until the prior segment has the given value. Continue moving backward through segments until the prior segment does NOT have the value. Ignore delims and whitespace.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Insert text from the current segment's predecessor up to and including the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

backwardThrough

public boolean backwardThrough(java.lang.String feature,
                               java.lang.Boolean value,
                               boolean ignoreDelimsAndWhitespace)
Go backward from the current segment until the prior segment has the given value. Continue moving backward through segments until the prior segment does NOT have the value.

If the feature/value combination is never found, the state will not change.

Insert text from the current segment's predecessor up to and including the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the feature matched (even if the state hasn't changed); otherwise, false.

backwardToBeginning

public boolean backwardToBeginning()
Go forward from the current segment until hitting the end.

Collect text up to, but not including, the final segment reached.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

splitAndPositionAtFirst

public boolean splitAndPositionAtFirst(java.lang.String feature)
Split the current segment with the feature function.

If successful, set the current segment to be the first new split; otherwise, remain at the current segment.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

splitAndPositionAfter

public boolean splitAndPositionAfter(java.lang.String feature)
Split the current segment with the feature function.

If successful, set the current segment to be the segment after the new split; otherwise, leave the current segment at its location.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

splitAndPositionAtFirst

public boolean splitAndPositionAtFirst(SplitFunction splitFunction)
Split the current segment with the split function.

If successful, set the current segment to be the first new split; otherwise, remain at the current segment.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

splitAndPositionAfter

public boolean splitAndPositionAfter(SplitFunction splitFunction)
Split the current segment with the split function.

If successful, set the current segment to be the segment after the new split; otherwise, leave the current segment at its location.

Returns:
true if the state has changed; otherwise, false.

join

public boolean join(int numSegments,
                    boolean ignoreDelimsAndWhitespace,
                    boolean positionAfter)
Join the current segment with the next segment(s).

The current text will be reset to be the newly joined segment's text. The machine will be positioned at the newly joined segment, unless positionAfter is true; in which case, the machine will be positioned after the joined segment.
